intro: Oxydectes scabra, commonly known as the rough oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive texture. Oxydectes scabra produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months.
